dmca.title: [ABUSE] Website Theft
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, March 03, 2005 3:25 PM
To: mkissiah@yahoo.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: Re: Fwd: [ABUSE] Website Theft

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1




Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/


This is a forwarded message
From: Michael Kissiah <mkissiah@yahoo.com>
To: The Planet Policy Enforcement <abuse@theplanet.com>
Date: Tuesday, March 1, 2005, 9:59:41 PM
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Website Theft

===8<==============Original message text=============== Thank you.  Please
add the following information to your evaluation.  In addition to the proof
already provided, there are old versions of our logo actually still residing
on their server at:

http://www.lawtrack.com/pi_directory/_borders/new_title2.gif
http://www.lawtrack.com/images/purcha1.gif
http://www.lawtrack.com/_borders/new_title.gif

Please let me know if this is adequate proof, or you require a formal
written statement as per your copyright infringement procedures at
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/index.html.

Thank you for your help.


- --- The Planet Policy Enforcement
<abuse@theplanet.com> wrote:
> -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
> Hash: SHA1
>
>
>
>
> Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the 
> address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.
>
> - --
> Thanks,
>
> Policy Enforcement
> The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
> http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
>
>
> This is a forwarded message
> From: Michael Kissiah <mkissiah@yahoo.com>
> To: manager@lawtrack.com
> Date: Monday, February 28, 2005, 11:11:37 PM
> Subject: [ABUSE] Website Theft
>
> ===8<==============Original message
> text===============
> Bill,
>
> We attempted to contact you via email and the phone number listed on 
> your website without any success.
> Websites are copyrighted the moment they are created.
> The ORIGINAL archive of our website,
> www.einvestigator.com, can be viewed at
>
http://web.archive.org/web/20030127004509/http://www.einvestigator.com/.
>  It is easy to prove that you copied everything from us to create 
> www.lawtrack.com.  Right down to our privacy policy.  If comparing 
> your website to our archive is not convincing enough, we can point to 
> numerous instances of our unique code, and even OUR affiliate links 
> still on your site.
>
> Please consider this to be a cease-and-desist order and remove the 
> website from the internet immediately.
>
> Thank you for your attention to this matter.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> __________________________________
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Yahoo! Mail - now with 250MB free storage. Learn more.
> http://info.mail.yahoo.com/mail_250
>
> ===8<===========End of original message text=========== -----BEGIN PGP 
> SIGNATURE-----
> Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
>
>
iD8DBQFCJPjsvK/XpJs6oyURAjJHAKCilVOwkDl/QAecO+Sn6OWNfA8EWQCggtN4

21:11:37 -0800 (PST)
> From: Michael Kissiah <mkissiah@yahoo.com>
> To: manager@lawtrack.com
> CC: copyright@amazon.com,
> pam@harrisdigitalpublishing.com,
> info@spectorsoft.com,
>         <pellison@dmqlaw.com>, <abuse@theplanet.com>
> Subject: [ABUSE] Website Theft
>
> Bill,
>
> We attempted to contact you via email and the phone number listed on 
> your website without any success.
> Websites are copyrighted the moment they are created.
> The ORIGINAL archive of our website,
> www.einvestigator.com, can be viewed at
>
http://web.archive.org/web/20030127004509/http://www.einvestigator.com/.
>  It is easy to prove that you copied everything from us to create 
> www.lawtrack.com.  Right down to our privacy policy.  If comparing 
> your website to our archive is not convincing enough, we can point to 
> numerous instances of our unique code, and even OUR affiliate links 
> still on your site.
>
> Please consider this to be a cease-and-desist order and remove the 
> website from the internet immediately.
>
> Thank you for your attention to this matter.
>
